intro: Lophopetalum celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticultural and ecological studies.
